page.title: 14Local history
page.content:
Part of Farnham Parish Church dates back to the time of the original Domesday.
At Scotton the Percy's had a house, since destroyed, next to the church, where their shield can be seen painted on the ceiling.
The area around Scotton and Brearton has had a long association with the Mountgarrett family.
The Parish Church of Brearton is owned by the Mountgarretts and rented to the village at a peppercorn rent. It was concecrated in 1837 and included Okany (the old spelling of Occaney) in its parish.
